import React from'react';import{useNavigate}from'react-router-dom';import{jsx as _jsx,jsxs as _jsxs}from"react/jsx-runtime";const NavigationBar=_ref=>{let{brandName,imageSrcPath,navItems}=_ref;const navigate=useNavigate();const handleNavigation=path=>{navigate(path);};/* 
    This uses bootstrap to return a styled navigation bar with a brand image, brand name, and navigation items.
    The navigation items are passed as props and are rendered as list items.
    When a navigation item is clicked, the index of the item and the path are passed to the handleNavigation function, 
    which sets the current path and navigates to the corresponding page using the useNavigate hook from react-router-dom.
  */return/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("nav",{className:"navbar navbar-expand-md",style:{backgroundColor:'#490c98'},children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"container-fluid",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("a",{className:"navbar-brand",href:"javascript:void(0)",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("img",{src:imageSrcPath,height:"60",className:"d-inline-block align-center me-2",alt:""}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("span",{className:"fw-bolder fs-4",children:brandName})]}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{className:"collapse navbar-collapse",id:"navbarSupportedContent",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("ul",{className:"navbar-nav me-auto mb-2 mb-md-1",children:navItems.map((item,index)=>/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("li",{className:"nav-item",onClick:()=>handleNavigation(item.path),children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("a",{className:"nav-link",href:"javascript:void(0)",children:item.label})},index))})})]})});};export default NavigationBar;
